newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian gold ends down, silver steady.
newsitem.headline: Indian gold ends down, silver steady.

text.p: ** Indian gold 24 carat closes 20 rupees lower at 4,825 rupees per 10 gramme.
** Gold biscuits (116.50 gramme each) end 200 rupees lower at 56,400 rupees per piece.
** Silver (.999) ends steady at 7,080 rupees per kg
Gold 24 carat closed Thursday 20 rupees lower at 4,825 rupees per 10 gramme rupees as demand resistance capped rally, dealers said.
A setback in world markets also led to profit-taking, they said.
Fresh arrivals were loe and volumes dull on Thursday, dealers said. Gold was up 10 rupees per 10 gramme on Wednesday.
Prices of gold biscuits ended 200 rupees lower at 56,400 rupees per piece, dealers said.
Silver (.999) closed at 7,080 rupees per kg, unchanged from the previous close but up 30 rupees per kg from the opening level as the market opened weak on setback in world prices, dealers said.
Fresh industrial buying later in the day helped local prices bounce back towards close, they said.
Market sentiment was sudbued for both metals at the close of the session, dealers said. (Conversion $1=35.81 rupees)
